entities.name: madam hooch
entities.description: Madam Hooch is a teacher who is present in the scene. She is mentioned as saying 'Oh — right — here you are, then, Potter,' which indicates her interaction with Harry Potter.

entities.name: weasley
entities.description: Weasley is a person who is sitting with Madam Hooch. His name is mentioned as being spoken by Madam Hooch.

entities.name: potter
entities.description: Potter is Harry Potter, the main character of the story. He is mentioned in the conversation between Madam Hooch and Weasley.

entities.name: cho chang
entities.description: Cho Chang is a fourth-year student who is playing as Seeker for Ravenclaw. She is mentioned by Wood as having some problems with injuries but has made a full recovery.

entities.name: wood
entities.description: Wood is the coach of Gryffindor team. He is giving instructions to his team and talking about Cho Chang.

entities.name: ravenclaw
entities.description: Ravenclaw is a team that is playing against Gryffindor. They are mentioned as having Cho Chang as their Seeker.

entities.name: gryﬀindor
entities.description: Gryffindor is the team that Wood is coaching. They are gathering around him for instructions.

entities.name: firebolt
entities.description: Firebolt is Harry's broomstick. It is mentioned by Wood as being better than Cho Chang's Comet Two Sixty.

entities.name: comet two sixty
entities.description: Comet Two Sixty is Cho Chang's broomstick. It is mentioned by Wood as looking like a joke next to the Firebolt.

relationships.description: Wood is coaching Gryffindor team. This relationship is mentioned in the text as 'the Gryﬀindor team gathered around Wood for his ﬁnal instructions'.
Wood is talking about Cho Chang, who is playing as Seeker for Ravenclaw. This relationship is mentioned in the text as 'It’s Cho Chang. She’s a fourth year, and she’s pretty good'.
Madam Hooch is interacting with Potter. This relationship is mentioned in the text as 'Oh — right — here you are, then, Potter'.

Wood is comparing Firebolt to Comet Two Sixty and says that it is better. This relationship is mentioned in the text as 'On the other hand, she rides a Comet Two Sixty, which is going to look like a joke next to the Firebolt'.
Potter owns Firebolt. This relationship is mentioned in the text as 'Harry mounted his Firebolt, and kicked oﬀ from the ground'.
